title: Adjust MangaCard title-cycle arrow position/color and fix chapter progress decimal display

requirements.text: In `frontend/src/components/manga/MangaCard.tsx`, move the title-cycle ArrowRight icon down by 5px from its current position (i.e., reduce the current upward Y-translation by 5px) while keeping the rest of the gutter layout behavior unchanged.

quotes: move the green arrow down 5 pixels

acceptanceCriteria: When alternate titles exist, the ArrowRight icon renders 5px lower than it currently does (relative to the card) while the rating block placement and alignment behavior remain unchanged.
When no alternate titles exist, the spacer element remains consistent with the arrowâ€™s adjusted vertical position (so rating alignment does not shift between the two states).

requirements.text: In `frontend/src/components/manga/MangaCard.tsx`, change the title-cycle ArrowRight icon color from green to a dark brown color.

quotes: make it dark brown color instead of green

acceptanceCriteria: The ArrowRight icon is no longer rendered with a green Tailwind class and instead renders as a dark brown color that is clearly distinguishable from the previous green.

requirements.text: Fix the "chapters read/chapters available" display so it correctly renders decimal values (e.g., `104.5/200.0` should display `104.5/200` or `104.5/200.0`, but must not truncate to `104/200`). This includes auditing `frontend/src/components/manga/MangaCard.tsx` and `frontend/src/utils/formatChapterNumber.ts` to ensure no rounding/truncation occurs in the displayed output.

quotes: also why can't the 'chapters read/chapters available' output display numbers with decimals?  (for example 104.5), it can hold them but not display them?  please fix.

acceptanceCriteria: If `manga.chaptersRead` is `104.5` and `manga.availableChapters` is `200`, the UI displays `104.5/200` (or equivalent that preserves the `.5`) in the chapter progress button text.
If both values are whole numbers (e.g., `104` and `200`), the UI displays them without unnecessary decimals (e.g., `104/200`).
Updating chapter progress with decimal inputs via the chapter progress popover persists and, after refresh/reload, the displayed value still includes the decimal portion (no truncation in display).

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose existing shadcn components instead).
nonGoals: Changing how chapter progress values are stored in the backend (this request is specifically about display behavior).
Adding new chapter-progress-related features beyond fixing decimal rendering.
